intro: Chrysolaena propinqua var. canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf chrysolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage.
